text: Evan Ravenel (born November 24, 1989), nicknamed E, is an American professional basketball player for Kumamoto Volters of the B.League.https://viapais.com.ar/santiago-del-estero/1337134-evan-ravenel-es- nuevo-refuerzo-de-quimsa/https://www.volters.jp/news/detail/id=13381 ==College career== He began his collegiate career at Boston College, and was transferred to the Ohio State Buckeyes. He helped the OSU advance to the NCAA Final Four as a college junior. ==Professional career== Ravenel played for the Ryukyu Golden Kings of Okinawa in 2015-16. The team won that season's bj league championship title and Ravenel was awarded playoff MVP. On January 16, 2017, he signed with the Akita Northern Happinets of B.League. In 2017-18, he played for BC Rilski Sportist in Bulgaria and posted 11.4 points and 5.6 rebounds per game. Ravenel signed with the Fukushima Firebonds of the B.League on August 15, 2018. ==Personal== Evan and his younger sister Erin are the children of Pamela and Eugene Ravenel. ==College statistics== |- |
